overview: Copilot model access for individual users has been simplified: newly released models are available directly inside Copilot features for Pro+, Pro, and Free users without needing to manage policies or visit settings pages.

detailed_explanation.title: What changed
bullets: Newly released models are now available directly within Copilot features for Copilot Pro+, Pro, and Free users.
Users no longer need to manage policies or visit settings pages to access new models.

detailed_explanation.title: How model selection works
bullets: You can choose a model manually, or let GitHub select one when Auto mode is enabled.

detailed_explanation.title: Policy and data usage
bullets: The article states existing data-usage policies remain unchanged and continue to apply.
Specific policy details are Not stated in the article (it links to the Trust Center).

detailed_explanation.title: Rollout notes
bullets: The change is rolling out over the next day.
If you donâ€™t see it yet, the guidance is to check back soon.

key_changes: New Copilot models are surfaced directly in Copilot features for Pro+, Pro, and Free users without extra settings steps.
Auto mode can select a model for you, or you can select a model yourself.
impact: Individual users should be able to try newly released models faster with fewer configuration steps.
Users who prefer explicit control can still pick specific models rather than relying on Auto mode.
Organizations relying on existing data-usage policy expectations should not see policy changes per the announcement.
caveats: The rollout is gradual over the next day, so availability may lag for some users.
Any differences in model availability across specific Copilot features are Not stated in the article.
insights: The announcement prioritizes reducing friction and ambiguity about model availability while preserving user choice.
By explicitly stating data-usage policies are unchanged, the article anticipates trust/governance concerns when models change.
